int __cvmx_helper_bgx_fifo_size ( int  xiface,
unsigned  lmac 
)

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Return the size of the BGX TX_FIFO for a given LMAC, or 0 if the requested LMAC is inactive.

TBD: Need also to add a "__cvmx_helper_bgx_speed()" function to return the speed of each LMAC.

Different modes take different amounts of time.

int __cvmx_helper_bgx_probe ( int  xiface  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Probe a SGMII interface and determine the number of ports connected to it. The SGMII interface should still be down after this call. This is used by interfaces using the bgx mac.

Parameters:
xiface Interface to probe
Returns:
Number of ports on the interface. Zero to disable.
static void __cvmx_helper_bgx_rgmii_link_set_down ( int  interface  )  [static]

This sequence brings down the link for the XCV RGMII interface.

Parameters:
interface Interface (BGX) number. Port index is always 0
static int __cvmx_helper_bgx_rgmii_speed ( cvmx_helper_link_info_t  link_info  )  [static]
int __cvmx_helper_bgx_sgmii_configure_loopback ( int  xipd_port,
int  enable_internal,
int  enable_external 
)

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Configure a port for internal and/or external loopback. Internal loopback causes packets sent by the port to be received by Octeon. External loopback causes packets received from the wire to sent out again. This is used by interfaces using the bgx mac.

Parameters:
xipd_port IPD/PKO port to loopback.
enable_internal Non zero if you want internal loopback
enable_external Non zero if you want external loopback
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure.
int __cvmx_helper_bgx_sgmii_enable ( int  xiface  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Bringup and enable a SGMII interface. After this call packet I/O should be fully functional. This is called with IPD enabled but PKO disabled. This is used by interfaces using the bgx mac.

Parameters:
xiface Interface to bring up
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure
static int __cvmx_helper_bgx_sgmii_hardware_init ( int  xiface,
int  num_ports 
) [static]

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Bring up the SGMII interface to be ready for packet I/O but leave I/O disabled using the GMX override. This function follows the bringup documented in 10.6.3 of the manual.

Parameters:
xiface Interface to bringup
num_ports Number of ports on the interface
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure

cvmx_helper_link_info_t __cvmx_helper_bgx_sgmii_link_get ( int  xipd_port  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Return the link state of an IPD/PKO port as returned by auto negotiation. The result of this function may not match Octeon's link config if auto negotiation has changed since the last call to cvmx_helper_link_set(). This is used by interfaces using the bgx mac.

Parameters:
xipd_port IPD/PKO port to query
Returns:
Link state
int __cvmx_helper_bgx_sgmii_link_set ( int  xipd_port,
cvmx_helper_link_info_t  link_info 
)

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Configure an IPD/PKO port for the specified link state. This function does not influence auto negotiation at the PHY level. The passed link state must always match the link state returned by cvmx_helper_link_get(). It is normally best to use cvmx_helper_link_autoconf() instead. This is used by interfaces using the bgx mac.

Parameters:
xipd_port IPD/PKO port to configure
link_info The new link state
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure
static void __cvmx_helper_bgx_sgmii_link_set_down ( int  node,
int  iface,
int  index 
) [static]

Sets a BGS SGMII link down.

Parameters:

iface BGX interface number
index BGX port index

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Configure an IPD/PKO port for the specified link state. This function does not influence auto negotiation at the PHY level. The passed link state must always match the link state returned by cvmx_helper_link_get(). It is normally best to use cvmx_helper_link_autoconf() instead. This is used by interfaces using the bgx mac.

Parameters:
xipd_port IPD/PKO port to configure
link_info The new link state
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure
int cvmx_bgx_set_backpressure_override ( int  xiface,
unsigned  port_mask 
)

Disables the sending of flow control (pause) frames on the specified BGX port(s).

Parameters:
xiface Which xiface
port_mask Mask (4bits) of which ports on the interface to disable backpressure on. 1 => disable backpressure 0 => enable backpressure
Returns:
0 on success -1 on error

FIXME: Should change the API to handle a single port in every invokation, for consistency with other API calls.

void cvmx_helper_bgx_disable ( int  xipd_port  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Disable the BGX port

Parameters:
xipd_port IPD port of the BGX interface to disable
cvmx_helper_interface_mode_t cvmx_helper_bgx_get_mode ( int  xiface,
int  index 
)

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Returns mode of each BGX LMAC (port). This is different than 'cvmx_helper_interface_get_mode()' which provides mode of an entire interface, but when BGX is in "mixed" mode this function should be called instead to get the protocol for each port (BGX LMAC) individually. Both function return the same enumerated mode.

Parameters:
xiface is the global interface identifier
index is the interface port index
Returns:
mode of the individual port
void cvmx_helper_bgx_rx_adr_ctl ( unsigned  node,
unsigned  interface,
unsigned  index,
unsigned  cam_accept,
unsigned  mcast_mode,
unsigned  bcast_accept 
)

This function configures the receive action taken for multicast, broadcast and dmac filter match packets.

Parameters:
node node number.
interface interface number
index port number
cam_accept 0: reject packets on dmac filter match 1: accept packet on dmac filter match
mcast_mode 0x0 = Force reject all multicast packets 0x1 = Force accept all multicast packets 0x2 = Use the address filter CAM
bcast_accept 0 = Reject all broadcast packets 1 = Accept all broadcast packets
void cvmx_helper_bgx_rx_pause_ctl ( unsigned  node,
unsigned  interface,
unsigned  index,
unsigned  ctl_bck,
unsigned  ctl_drp 
)

This function control how the hardware handles incoming PAUSE packets.

The most common modes of operation: ctl_bck = 1, ctl_drp = 1: hardware handles everything ctl_bck = 0, ctl_drp = 0: software sees all PAUSE frames ctl_bck = 0, ctl_drp = 1: all PAUSE frames are completely ignored

Parameters:
node node number.
interface interface number
index port number
ctl_bck 1: Forward PAUSE information to TX block
ctl_drp 1: Drop control PAUSE frames.
void cvmx_helper_bgx_set_jabber ( int  xiface,
unsigned  index,
unsigned  size 
)

Set maximum packet size for a BGX port.

void cvmx_helper_bgx_set_mac ( int  xipd_port,
int  bcst,
int  mcst,
uint64_t  mac 
)

Set mac for the ipd_port.

Parameters:
xipd_port ipd_port to set the mac
bcst If set, accept all broadcast packets
mcst Multicast mode 0 = Force reject all multicast packets 1 = Force accept all multicast packets 2 = use the address filter CAM.
mac mac address for the ipd_port, or 0 to disable MAC filtering
int cvmx_helper_bgx_shutdown_port ( int  xiface,
int  index 
)

Shutdown a BGX port.

void cvmx_helper_bgx_tx_options ( unsigned  node,
unsigned  interface,
unsigned  index,
bool  fcs_enable,
bool  pad_enable 
)

Function to control the generation of FCS, padding by the BGX.

int  index,
bool  enable 
)

Enables or disables autonegotiation for an interface.

Parameters:
xiface interface to set autonegotiation
index port index
enable true to enable autonegotiation, false to disable it
Returns:
0 for success, -1 on error.
int cvmx_helper_set_fec ( int  xiface,
int  index,
bool  enable 
)

Enables or disables forward error correction.

Parameters:
xiface interface
index port index
enable set to true to enable FEC, false to disable
Returns:
0 for success, -1 on error

: If autonegotiation is enabled then autonegotiation will be restarted for negotiating FEC.

Variable Documentation

CVMX_SHARED int(* cvmx_helper_bgx_override_autoneg)(int xiface, int index) = NULL

cvmx_helper_bgx_override_autoneg(int xiface, int index) is a function pointer to override enabling/disabling of autonegotiation for SGMII, 10G-KR or 40G-KR4 interfaces.

This function is called when interface is initialized.

CVMX_SHARED int(* cvmx_helper_bgx_override_fec)(int xiface, int index) = NULL
const int debug = 0 [static]
